description: Automatically generates and updates project documentation from code comments, README files, and API definitions
author: JSONbored
features: Real-time documentation generation from code comments
Multi-language support (JavaScript, TypeScript, Python, Go, Rust)
API documentation extraction from JSDoc, docstrings, and comments

configuration.scriptContent:
#!/usr/bin/env bash

# Read the tool input from stdin
INPUT=$(cat)
TOOL_NAME=$(echo "$INPUT" | jq -r '.tool_name')
FILE_PATH=$(echo "$INPUT" | jq -r '.tool_input.file_path // .tool_input.path // ""')

if [ -z "$FILE_PATH" ]; then
  exit 0
fi

# Check if it's a documentation-relevant file
if [[ "$FILE_PATH" == *.js ]] || [[ "$FILE_PATH" == *.jsx ]] || [[ "$FILE_PATH" == *.ts ]] || [[ "$FILE_PATH" == *.tsx ]] || [[ "$FILE_PATH" == *.py ]] || [[ "$FILE_PATH" == *.go ]] || [[ "$FILE_PATH" == *.rs ]] || [[ "$FILE_PATH" == *README* ]] || [[ "$FILE_PATH" == *.md ]]; then
  echo "ðŸ“š Documentation-relevant file detected: $FILE_PATH" >&2
  
  # Create docs directory if it doesn't exist
  mkdir -p ./docs
  
  # JavaScript/TypeScript documentation
  if [[ "$FILE_PATH" == *.js ]] || [[ "$FILE_PATH" == *.jsx ]] || [[ "$FILE_PATH" == *.ts ]] || [[ "$FILE_PATH" == *.tsx ]]; then
    echo "ðŸŸ¡ JavaScript/TypeScript file - checking for documentation..." >&2
    
    # Check for JSDoc comments
    if [ -f "$FILE_PATH" ]; then
      JSDOC_COMMENTS=$(grep -c '/\*\*' "$FILE_PATH" 2>/dev/null || echo "0")
      FUNCTIONS=$(grep -c '^\s*\(function\|const\s.*=>\|class\)' "$FILE_PATH" 2>/dev/null || echo "0")
      
      echo "ðŸ“Š Found $JSDOC_COMMENTS JSDoc comments and $FUNCTIONS functions/classes" >&2
      
      if [ "$JSDOC_COMMENTS" -gt 0 ]; then
        # Try generating JSDoc documentation
        if command -v npx &> /dev/null; then
          if npx jsdoc --version &> /dev/null 2>&1; then
            echo "ðŸ“ Generating JSDoc documentation..." >&2
            npx jsdoc "$FILE_PATH" -d ./docs/jsdoc 2>/dev/null && echo "âœ… JSDoc documentation generated" >&2
          fi
          
          # Try jsdoc2md for markdown output
          if npx jsdoc2md --version &> /dev/null 2>&1; then
            echo "ðŸ“ Generating Markdown documentation..." >&2
            npx jsdoc2md "$FILE_PATH" > "./docs/$(basename "$FILE_PATH" .js).md" 2>/dev/null && echo "âœ… Markdown documentation generated" >&2
          fi
        fi
      else
        echo "ðŸ’¡ Consider adding JSDoc comments to improve documentation coverage" >&2
      fi
      
      # TypeScript-specific documentation
      if [[ "$FILE_PATH" == *.ts ]] || [[ "$FILE_PATH" == *.tsx ]]; then
        if command -v npx &> /dev/null && npx typedoc --version &> /dev/null 2>&1; then
          echo "ðŸ“ Generating TypeDoc documentation..." >&2
          npx typedoc "$FILE_PATH" --out ./docs/typedoc 2>/dev/null && echo "âœ… TypeDoc documentation generated" >&2
        else
          echo "ðŸ’¡ Install TypeDoc for comprehensive TypeScript documentation: npm install -g typedoc" >&2
        fi
      fi
    fi
    
  # Python documentation
  elif [[ "$FILE_PATH" == *.py ]]; then
    echo "ðŸ Python file - checking for documentation..." >&2
    
    if [ -f "$FILE_PATH" ]; then
      DOCSTRINGS=$(grep -c '"""\|'\''\''\'''' "$FILE_PATH" 2>/dev/null || echo "0")
      FUNCTIONS=$(grep -c '^def\s\|^class\s' "$FILE_PATH" 2>/dev/null || echo "0")
      
      echo "ðŸ“Š Found $DOCSTRINGS docstrings and $FUNCTIONS functions/classes" >&2
      
      # Try generating Python documentation
      if command -v pdoc &> /dev/null; then
        echo "ðŸ“ Generating pdoc documentation..." >&2
        pdoc "$FILE_PATH" --html --output-dir ./docs/python 2>/dev/null && echo "âœ… Python documentation generated" >&2
      elif command -v python &> /dev/null; then
        if python -c "import pydoc" 2>/dev/null; then
          echo "ðŸ“ Generating pydoc documentation..." >&2
          python -m pydoc -w "$FILE_PATH" 2>/dev/null && echo "âœ… Python documentation generated" >&2
        fi
      fi
      
      if [ "$DOCSTRINGS" -eq 0 ] && [ "$FUNCTIONS" -gt 0 ]; then
        echo "ðŸ’¡ Consider adding docstrings to Python functions and classes" >&2
      fi
    fi
    
  # Go documentation
  elif [[ "$FILE_PATH" == *.go ]]; then
    echo "ðŸ¹ Go file - checking for documentation..." >&2
    
    if [ -f "$FILE_PATH" ] && command -v go &> /dev/null; then
      COMMENTS=$(grep -c '^//\s' "$FILE_PATH" 2>/dev/null || echo "0")
      echo "ðŸ“Š Found $COMMENTS documentation comments" >&2
      
      echo "ðŸ“ Generating Go documentation..." >&2
      go doc "$FILE_PATH" > "./docs/$(basename "$FILE_PATH" .go).txt" 2>/dev/null && echo "âœ… Go documentation generated" >&2
    fi
    
  # Rust documentation
  elif [[ "$FILE_PATH" == *.rs ]]; then
    echo "ðŸ¦€ Rust file - checking for documentation..." >&2
    
    if [ -f "$FILE_PATH" ] && command -v cargo &> /dev/null; then
      DOC_COMMENTS=$(grep -c '^///\|^//!' "$FILE_PATH" 2>/dev/null || echo "0")
      echo "ðŸ“Š Found $DOC_COMMENTS documentation comments" >&2
      
      if [ "$DOC_COMMENTS" -gt 0 ]; then
        echo "ðŸ“ Generating Rust documentation..." >&2
        cargo doc --no-deps --target-dir ./docs/rust 2>/dev/null && echo "âœ… Rust documentation generated" >&2
      else
        echo "ðŸ’¡ Consider adding /// documentation comments to Rust code" >&2
      fi
    fi
    
  # README and markdown documentation
  elif [[ "$FILE_PATH" == *README* ]] || [[ "$FILE_PATH" == *.md ]]; then
    echo "ðŸ“ Markdown file - analyzing documentation structure..." >&2
    
    if [ -f "$FILE_PATH" ]; then
      HEADERS=$(grep -c '^#' "$FILE_PATH" 2>/dev/null || echo "0")
      CODE_BLOCKS=$(grep -c '^```' "$FILE_PATH" 2>/dev/null || echo "0")
      LINKS=$(grep -c '\[.*\](.*)' "$FILE_PATH" 2>/dev/null || echo "0")
      
      echo "ðŸ“Š Document structure: $HEADERS headers, $CODE_BLOCKS code blocks, $LINKS links" >&2
      
      # Check for common README sections
      if [[ "$FILE_PATH" == *README* ]]; then
        echo "ðŸ“‹ Checking README completeness..." >&2
        
        REQUIRED_SECTIONS=("Installation" "Usage" "API" "Contributing" "License")
        MISSING_SECTIONS=()
        
        for section in "${REQUIRED_SECTIONS[@]}"; do
          if ! grep -qi "^#.*$section" "$FILE_PATH"; then
            MISSING_SECTIONS+=("$section")
          fi
        done
        
        if [ ${#MISSING_SECTIONS[@]} -eq 0 ]; then
          echo "âœ… README contains all recommended sections" >&2
        else
          echo "ðŸ’¡ Consider adding these sections: ${MISSING_SECTIONS[*]}" >&2
        fi
        
        # Check for project metadata
        if [ -f "package.json" ]; then
          PROJECT_NAME=$(jq -r '.name // "unknown"' package.json 2>/dev/null)
          PROJECT_DESC=$(jq -r '.description // ""' package.json 2>/dev/null)
          
          if ! grep -q "$PROJECT_NAME" "$FILE_PATH"; then
            echo "ðŸ’¡ Consider mentioning project name '$PROJECT_NAME' in README" >&2
          fi
        fi
      fi
      
      # Check for broken links (basic check)
      if [ "$LINKS" -gt 0 ]; then
        echo "ðŸ”— Found $LINKS links - consider running a link checker" >&2
      fi
    fi
  fi
  
  # General documentation quality tips
  echo "" >&2
  echo "ðŸ“‹ Documentation Best Practices:" >&2
  echo "   â€¢ Add clear function/method descriptions" >&2
  echo "   â€¢ Include parameter types and return values" >&2
  echo "   â€¢ Provide usage examples in documentation" >&2
  echo "   â€¢ Keep README updated with latest changes" >&2
  
else
  echo "File $FILE_PATH is not relevant for documentation generation, skipping" >&2
fi

exit 0

useCases: Code quality improvement through documentation analysis
